kauherte: Not trying to start shit, but why do you have to force yourself to change your language? It might be that she can do some things better than you, that's not a problem unless you decide it is. Something like the crow in the last picture just does get more difficult the bigger you get, on the other hand you can very likely lift more weight than her. Powerlifters actually use their giant bellies to bounce off in the squat. Different types of bodies have different strengths, but hers is very probably more effective at yoga. Doesn't mean you shouldn't do yoga, just means that poses are easier when you're lighter and smaller. That's why handstand artists are mostly under 5.3" in addition to being very lean.

You are an inspiration darling 💕

lillianambrose: @fatgirlflow would you mind explaining more about using effective/ineffective when talking about your body? Would love to learn more about positive self talk!
missriss12: I started taking yoga classes a few months back. While I’m fairly confident with myself, admittedly I felt out of place. My body didn’t move like all these other long and lean ladies’ did in the class. I had to modify the moves or just stay in child’s pose if there was certain pose I couldn’t do at all. The instructor was incredibly kind and accommodating but it still took a lot of self talk to feel comfortable with being the only fat girl in class. After a few classes, stretching at home and remembering I was doing this for myself, I started to be more comfortable. Yoga has taught me to listen to my body and to connect with it in ways I never have. It’s truly amazing. This year I’ve been trying to actively not assign “good” or “bad” to body descriptors, specifically mine and remembering that my body just is. I always love your content. It somehow always gets me right in the feels 💞
mistressvioleta: What a body-affirming post. 💗 I have long heard therapists use “effective” and “ineffective” as opposed to more judgmental words, but it didn’t click that I never tried using them myself until you asked that very important question. Thank you for this. I love the vibe you share with your sister.
